sols_html:
The inner product is defined as

\[\begin{aligned} \left \langle f,g \right \rangle=\int_{0}^{1}f(t)\overline{g(t)}dt\end{aligned}\]

This is the continuous equivalent of the inner product for vectors, where we have the sum of the multiplied components of the vectors.
